info.name: Amio Messaging API
info.description:
Amio Messaging API is a service you can use for implementing various messengers into your software. It provides endpoints for sending messages, creating channels, etc.

The full API reference documentation can be found at [https://docs.amio.io](https://docs.amio.io/v1.0/reference).

item.name: Messages

request.description: List messages of given Facebook Messenger channel and contact. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#facebook-messenger-messages-list-messages).

item.name: Facebook Messenger

request.description: List messages of given Facebook Messenger channel and contact. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#facebook-messenger-messages-list-messages).

response.name: List Messages

request.description: Send text message using Page Scoped user id. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#section-user-id).
Send text message using Phone Number. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#section-phone-number).
Send text message using User Ref. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#section-user-ref).

response.name: Receipt
Structure - Title & Text
Structure

request.description: Send structure message with horizontal scroll. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/v1.0/reference#facebook-messenger-messages-structure-horizontal-scroll).

response.name: Structure - Horizontal Scroll

request.description: Send message with quick replies. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/v1.0/reference#facebook-messenger-messages-quick-replies).

response.name: Metadata

item.description: Messages resource is the main entry point for sending messages. See [Documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#facebook-messenger-messages).

item.name: Mobile

request.description: List messages of given Mobile channel and contact. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#mobile-messages-list-messages).

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: X-Application-Context
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-RateLimit-Limit
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-RateLimit-Remaining
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-RateLimit-Reset
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Total-Count
header.description: Custom header

item.description: Messages resource is the main entry point for sending messages. See [Documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#mobile-messages).

item.name: Viber Bot

request.description: List messages of given Viber channel and contact. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#viber-messages-list-messages).

response.name: Structure

request.description: Send structure message with horizontal scroll. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#viber-messages-structure-horizontal-scroll).

item.description: Messages resource is the main entry point for sending messages. See [Documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#messages).

item.name: Notifications

request.description: Send notification that all messages have been read. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#facebook-messenger-notifications-send-notification).
Send notification that all messages have been read. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#facebook-messenger-notifications-send-notification).

item.name: Facebook Messenger

request.description: Send notification that all messages have been read. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#facebook-messenger-notifications-send-notification).

item.description: Notifications resource is used for sending various events like messages read or typing to the contact. See [Documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#notifications).
Notifications resource is used for sending various events like messages read or typing to the contact. See [Documentation](https://docs.amio.io/reference#facebook-messenger-notifications).

header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Location
header.description: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: X-Application-Context
header.description: Custom header

item.description: Channel represents a medium through which you can send and receive message. See [Documentation](https://docs.amio.io/v1.0/reference#channels).

item.name: Contacts

request.description: List contacts of given Facebook Messenger channel. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/v1.0/reference#facebook-messenger-contacts-list-contacts).
Get contact of given Facebook Messenger channel. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/v1.0/reference#facebook-messenger-contacts-get-contact).
Delete contact of given Facebook Messenger channel. See [documentation](https://docs.amio.io/v1.0/reference#facebook-messenger-contacts-delete-contact).
